meanings.definition: The quality or state of being voracious.
meanings.sent1: Her voracity for books was unmatched; she could finish a novel in a day.
meanings.sent2: The lion's voracity for meat drove it to hunt every day.
meanings.sent3: His voracity for pizza was so extreme that he once ate an entire large pizza by himself.
meanings.sent4: The voracity of the wildfire consumed everything in its path, leaving only ashes behind.
meanings.sent5: The voracity of the student's hunger for knowledge led him to read every book in the library.

meanings.definition: The quality of being eager or enthusiastic in some desire or pursuit.
meanings.sent1: The team's voracity for victory pushed them to train harder than ever before.
meanings.sent2: Her voracity for adventure led her to travel to exotic locations around the world.
meanings.sent3: His voracity for collecting stamps made him the envy of all his friends.
meanings.sent4: The voracity with which she pursued her dreams inspired those around her.
meanings.sent5: The voracity of the crowd's cheers motivated the athlete to give it her all.
